channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: CCPD, ISSS to Hold “Working in the U.S.: CPT and Internships” Session for Undergraduate Students
item.description: Date: Friday, January 31, 2025 2:00 PM - 3:00 PM - Register to join the Center for Career and Professional Development (CCPD) and International Services for Students and Scholars (ISSS) for an in-person workshop to learn about the internship search and the ways to get Curricular Practical Training (CPT) to work in the U.S. before graduation! This session has information that is specific to undergraduate students.
item.author: Students

item.title: Join the MANE Student Advisor Council for Cookies, Coffee, and Commentary!
item.description: Date: Friday, January 24, 2025 9:00 AM - 4:00 PM - Stop by the table on the second floor of the JEC to provide the MANE Department with feedback on the Fall 2024 semester, and enjoy free cookies and coffee while you’re there!
item.author: Students

item.title: Book Your Appointment with COMM+D Online!
item.description: Are you working on a writing assignment, oral presentation, or visual design project? Whether you’re at the beginning brainstorming stages or finishing up your final revisions, the Center for Global Communication+Design (Comm+D) can help, so be sure to schedule an appointment with a member of the Center’s trained staff!
item.author: Students

item.title: DotCIO Posts Reminder Regarding Compliance with Campus Email Policy
item.description: Members of DotCIO’s IT Security team wish to remind all members of the Rensselaer community that Institute policy states that email accounts obtained through third parties may not be used in conducting the business of the Institute, and that ensuring compliance with the Rensselaer email policy is crucial.
item.author: Community

item.title: Rensselaer at Work to Hold Analytics, Machine Learning, AI Review
item.description: Date: Tuesday, January 28, 2025 7:00 PM - 7:30 PM - Register to join Rensselaer at Work Dean Aric Krause, Ph.D., as he highlights Rensselaer’s online, project-based graduate certificate programs in Analytics, Machine Learning & AI. Attendees will learn how data can inform better decisions, and review an analytic method that can be used regardless of the tools at hand.
item.author: Community

item.title: Don’t Miss the Big Red Freakout!
item.description: Date: Saturday, February 1, 2025 4:30 PM - 11:30 PM - Join other RPI hockey fans to enjoy a buffet dinner, have face painting and “tattoos” done courtesy of the Red & White Student Organization, and enjoy a Pep Band performance! After the game, take the shuttle back to the Heffner Alumni House to meet the men’s hockey team and coaches, enjoy a cash bar and complimentary hot drinks, desserts, and snacks.
item.author: Community

item.title: “Critical Intimacies” Event to Feature Filmmaker Thuy-Han Nguyen-Chi, Researcher Katie Kirkland
item.description: Date: Friday, January 31, 2025 7:00 PM - How can we practice critical intimacy in art, cinema, and theory? Register for this lecture from artist and filmmaker Thuy-Han Nguyen-Chi, with writer and researcher Katie Kirkland, to encounter artistic and theoretical works by female practitioners with East and Southeast Asian ancestry whose work grapples with legacies of Western imperialism.
item.author: Community

item.title: 2024 Form W-2 Now Available on Employee Self-Service System
item.description: Rensselaer’s Payroll Office is pleased to announce to all members of the campus community that the 2024 W-2 information is now available via the Rensselaer Self-Service Information System. Paper forms will be mailed to by January 31, 2025.
item.author: Community

item.title: Don’t Miss the Mayor’s Cup Alumni and Fan Reception!
item.description: Date: Saturday, January 25, 2025 3:00 PM - 8:00 PM - Join RPI alumni and hockey fans at a reception at the MVP Arena in Albany, as the men’s and women’s Engineers take on Union! The reception begins at 4:30 p.m. and includes complimentary snacks, a cash bar, and remarks from Athletics staff; there is no charge to attend the reception, but you must purchase your own game ticket through the MVP Box Office.
item.author: Community

item.title: “Tips for Incorporating Digital Story Telling as Assignments” to be Topic of Faculty/Staff Quick Learn Webinar
item.description:
Date: Monday, January 27, 2025 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM - Register to join Maureen Fodera, of the Office of Undergraduate Education, for a workshop that will discuss a high overview of the meaning of digital story telling, its advantages, and story-telling assignment practices, as well as review the Six-Word Story, Six Unique Shots assignment concept.

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
